intro: Homalium serratum, commonly known as the serrated homalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
